## createRouterModule() function

Create a Router module for use with compose().

Like createElModule(adapter), this takes configuration at module creation time and returns a Module that can be composed with other modules.

**Signature:**

```typescript
createRouterModule: (routes: RouteConfig[], options?: RouterOptions) => Module<"router", Router, {
    signal: SignalFactory;
    computed: ComputedFactory;
}>
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

routes


</td><td>

[RouteConfig](../routeconfig/)<!-- -->\[\]


</td><td>

Route configuration (pure data)


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[RouterOptions](../routeroptions/)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Router options (initialPath, etc.)


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[Module](../../core/module/)<!-- -->&lt;"router", [Router](../router/)<!-- -->, { signal: [SignalFactory](../../signals/signalfactory/)<!-- -->; computed: [ComputedFactory](../../signals/computedfactory/)<!-- -->; }&gt;

## Example


```typescript
import { compose } from '@rimitive/core';
import { SignalModule, ComputedModule } from '@rimitive/signals/extend';
import { createRouterModule } from '@rimitive/router';

const routes = [
  { id: 'home', path: '' },
  { id: 'about', path: 'about' },
  { id: 'products', path: 'products', children: [
    { id: 'product-detail', path: ':id' }
  ]}
];

const svc = compose(
  SignalModule,
  ComputedModule,
  createRouterModule(routes, { initialPath: '/' })
);

// Router is now part of the composed context
const { router, signal, computed } = svc;

// Use in view layer
match(router.matches, (matches) => {
  const route = matches[0];
  if (!route) return NotFound();
  return componentMap[route.id]({ params: route.params });
});
```
